The checks don't fail because it's not disallowed to introduce failing tests, after all. But it results in a confusing situation.
https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/32425
https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/32426
Who wants less noise in new PRs? https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/32427
It's funny that we added Dependabot for code that hasn't been touched since 2013 :) https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/32428
Hey, it looks like the HTML spec lists the `contextmenu` event in the list of events, but that event is not fired from anywhere in the spec
content.formatted_body: Hey, it looks like the HTML spec lists the contextmenu event in the list of events, but that event is not fired from anywhere in the spec

content.body: It seems like before https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/2742 there was spec text defining when to fire it, but I'm not sure if removing it was a bug, or if that text actually moved to some other spec
All browsers fire the event on right-click, so the discussion about planned browser support arguments clearly only applies to the `<menu>` element
content.formatted_body: All browsers fire the event on right-click, so the discussion about planned browser support arguments clearly only applies to the <menu> element

content.body: * All browsers fire the event on right-click, so the discussion about planned browser support arguments clearly only applies to the `<menu>` element, not to the `contextmenu` event
content.formatted_body: * All browsers fire the event on right-click, so the discussion about planned browser support arguments clearly only applies to the <menu> element, not to the contextmenu event

m.new_content.body: All browsers fire the event on right-click, so the discussion about planned browser support arguments clearly only applies to the `<menu>` element, not to the `contextmenu` event
m.new_content.formatted_body: All browsers fire the event on right-click, so the discussion about planned browser support arguments clearly only applies to the <menu> element, not to the contextmenu event
